description: Euclid-Mullin sequence (A000945) with initial value a(1)=8191 instead of a(1)=2.
links: Sean A. Irvine, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..59
mathematica: a[1]=8191; a[n_] := First[ Flatten[ FactorInteger[ 1+Product[ a[ j ], {j, 1, n-1} ] ] ] ]; Array[a, 10]
prog: (PARI) spf(n)=my(f=factor(n)[1,1]);f;first(m)={my(v=vector(m)); v[1]=8191; for(i=2, m, v[i]=spf(1+prod(j=1, i-1, v[j]))); v;} /* _Anders Hellstr√∂m_, Aug 18 2015 */
author: _Labos Elemer_
extensions: More terms from _Sean A. Irvine_, Sep 20 2012
a(30)-a(38) from _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 21 2012
